name: The Ecology and Conservation of Migratory Birds
body: ### Welcome to the Ecology and Conservation of Migratory Birds This website will be our home base for the R portion of the course. It will contain all of the R exercises and includes links to help files and data that we will use throughout the course. *** ### Getting Started R has become the universal quantitative interface for ecologists – it’s free, powerful, flexible enough to do everything but write manuscripts for you, and is relatively user-friendly. To get the most from this course, we strongly suggest completing a select set of self-guided learning exercises for R in the SWIRL R-package. Instructions for using SWIRL are located here and include the list of courses we would like you to complete prior to arrival. If you haven't already, be sure to: * Download and install the current version of R ([available here](https://cran.r-project.org/)) * Download and install R Studio ([available here](https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/)) *** ### Support or Contact If you are having trouble navigating this page or have a question with page content, please send an email to [Brian Evans](https://bsevans.unc@gmail.com).
